remarks: Optimized version of ~ fsump1 for making sums of a concrete number of terms.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Apr-2014.)
statement:
fsump1i.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
fsump1i.2 $e |- N = ( K + 1 ) $.
fsump1i.3 $e |- ( k = N -> A = B ) $.
fsump1i.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> A e. CC ) $.
fsump1i.5 $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. Z /\ sum_ k e. ( M ... K ) A = S ) ) $.
fsump1i.6 $e |- ( ph -> ( S + B ) = T ) $.
fsump1i $p |- ( ph -> ( N e. Z /\ sum_ k e. ( M ... N ) A = T ) ) $.
$d B k $.
$d K k $.
$d M k $.
$d N k $.
$d k ph $.
